Package au.edu.anu.twcore.rngFactory

Class RngFactory

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.twcore.rngFactory.RngFactory
public class RngFactory extends Object

Simple random number stream factory that manages resetting seeds in various ways.

Usage: Model developers create a stream as:

RandomFactory.makeRandom("test1", 0, ResetType.ONRUNSTART, SeedSource.SECURE, new [Pcg32()||XSRandom()||Random()]);

Then use it as:

Random rns = RandomFactory.getRandom("test1");
rns.nextDouble(); etc

This system contains a table of 1000 random numbers that have been generated from atmospheric noise. This can be used as seeds by the given index if SeedSource.TABLE is used. Alternatively, seeds can also be generated by a unique instance of the native java Random algorithm.

  • Method Details

    • newInstance

      public static RngFactory.Generator newInstance​(String name, int seedIndex, RngResetType resetType, RngSeedSourceType source, RngAlgType algType)
      There are 3 random number generators available. The currently available generators are:
      1. Java.util.Random - medium speed, poor quality;
      2. au.edu.anu.fses.rng.XSRandom - very fast (76% faster than Java.util.Random), medium quality
      3. au.edu.anu.fses.rng.Pcg32 - fast (56% faster than Java.util.Random) and good quality
      The choice is really between 3 (faster) & 4 (better quality).
      Parameters:
      name - unique name
      seedIndex - index into array[0..999] of naturally generated random numbers to act as seeds for resetting.
      resetType - type of reset method (NEVER, ONRUNSTART)
